page.title: 05A view of Chilcompton
page.content: {Chilcompton}is a small village. The part which I live in is on the top of a hill. The very old part is situated in the valley.{The River Somer}runs it's course from the top of the village down through the watercress beds, past the pig farm, to a beautiful river through the centre of the village known as{The Street Ponds. As well as a watercress farm and a pig farm, the village until recently had a large saw mill. This closed down in 1984 due to{Dutch Elm Disease.}Many of the villagers became unemployed and many of the men in the village found it difficult getting other work. In the village there are four places of worship, one Catholic, two Church of England and a Methodist. There is a village school, a post office, two grocery shops and a craft shop. I like living here, because it is so friendly
